text: The 2015–16 Connecticut Whale (NWHL) season was the first in franchise history and the National Women's Hockey League's inaugural season. ==Offseason== * On July 1, the Whale signed former BU Terriers blueliner and 2015 Clarkson Cup champion Kaleigh Fratkin to a contract, making her the first Canadian to sign an NWHL contract. ==Regular season== ===Standings=== ===Game log=== {| class="toccolours" style="width:100%;
